summary: Green hydrogen could one day provide a clean energy solution to some of the trickiest sectors to decarbonize. title: OPEC+ Oil Production Jumped by 630,000 Bpd in September
summary: The members of the OPEC+ group boosted their production in September by 630,000 barrels per day (bpd) from August as the alliance last month completed the unwinding of 2.2 million bpd cuts that began in April this year. Total OPEC+ crude oil production averaged 43.05 million barrels per day (bpd) i…

title: Algeria Secures $5.4 Billion Oil and Gas Deal with Saudi Midad Energy
summary: Algerian state oil and gas firm Sonatrach has signed a $5.4-billion exploration and production agreement with Saudi Arabian firm Midad Energy, Algerian news outlet Ennahar TV reported on Monday, citing a statement from Sonatrach. title: China’s Coal Imports Jumped to 9-Month High in September
summary: Chinese coal imports surged in September to the highest level in nine months and the highest for 2025 amid falling output and rising prices within China, official data showed on Monday. The world’s top coal consumer, China, imported 46 million tons of coal in September, the highest level so far thi…

title: Greenpeace Threatens Crown Estate With Offshore Wind Lawsuit
summary: Greenpeace has accused the British Crown Estate of inflating the cost of offshore wind through its monopoly on the UK’s seabed, the Financial Times has reported, adding the environmentalist group had called on the Crown Estate to either change its lease conditions or face a lawsuit. title: Big Oil forced to confront some tough choices as 'monster profits' fade into memory
summary: A weaker crude price environment is expected to put the industry’s generous shareholder payouts at serious risk over the coming months.
